hero_title: Data Scientist specialized in AI and NLP
hero_description: Data Scientist — exploring, building, and connecting ideas from data to cloud
about_intro: Final-year Data Science student at ENSAI, with a strong background in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning.
about_text: I'm a Data Scientist with experience in statistical modeling, supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, NLP, and Generative AI. My academic path shaped a rigorous and analytical mindset.
about_desc: I build scalable and modular pipelines, from preprocessing and vector indexing to LLM-powered generation, focusing on robustness, interpretability, and clean architecture.
about_extra: I enjoy solving end-to-end real-world problems, blending classic ML with modern tools like LLMs, embeddings, and vector databases, always aiming for clarity and clean, maintainable code.
edu1_school: ENSAI – National School for Statistics and Information Analysis (Ker Lann, Rennes)
edu1_desc: Grande École under the INSEE – Top-tier program in statistics & AI
edu1_course1: Key courses: Supervised & unsupervised learning, deep learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow), NLP with Transformers, generative AI (LLMs, RAG), time series, Bayesian inference, stochastic calculus
edu1_course2: Big Data & Engineering: Spark, Hadoop, SQL, APIs, Docker, MLOps, cloud deployment
edu1_course3: Applied work: Real-world projects in fraud detection, recommendation systems, and NLP
projects_subtitle: A selection of my end-to-end data & AI projects
project1_desc: Fully local pipeline for moderating user reviews: toxicity detection, explainability, and performance evaluation — privacy-friendly and cloud-free.
project1_desc_long: ReviewGuardian is a fully local and explainable AI pipeline for moderating user-generated reviews. It detects toxic comments using multiple models (Naive Bayes, Logistic Regression, Random Forest), explains predictions with SHAP, and provides a Streamlit-based interface for real-time moderation. All components run offline, with no external API calls — ensuring complete data privacy and auditability.
project2_desc: Intelligently recommends tracks using Word2Vec and NLP embeddings. Fully local app with interactive filters and playlist export.
project2_desc_long:
This hybrid music recommender system combines two powerful engines: (1) collaborative filtering based on Word2Vec (co-listening patterns), and (2) semantic similarity using Sentence-BERT embeddings. The application offers:
  • Dual similarity engine: co-occurrence (Word2Vec) + semantic matching (Sentence-BERT)
  • Interactive filters for genre, duration, mood, and decade
  • Exploration mode with audio features (energy, danceability, positivity)
  • Real-time KPIs: 94.2% precision, 85ms latency, 4.6/5 user rating
  • Advanced dashboard with heatmaps, radar charts, and Spotify benchmarks
  • Smart playlist generator with CSV export and feedback integration
  • Fully local deployment — no cloud, no API dependency
Built with performance, explainability, and personalization in mind — a powerful sandbox for experimenting with music recommender systems.
project3_desc: Hybrid approach (Machine Learning + Statistical Rules) optimizing Cross-Sell. Streamlit application with dashboards and market simulation.
project3_desc_long:
This project addresses the Zimnat Insurance Recommendation challenge (Zindi): predicting a client's missing products using a snapshot of their current portfolio.
  • Hybrid Approach (Dual Engine): Combines a Statistical Baseline (Bayesian) for robustness with a CatBoost model for fine-grained personalization.
  • Anti-Cheat Filter: Strict business rules ensuring no already-owned products are recommended (zero commercial errors).
  • Modular Streamlit App: 5 dedicated interfaces (Executive Dashboard, Business Insights, Client Inspector for agents, Market Simulator).
  • Business Impact: Transition from Mass Marketing to Precision Marketing to maximize LTV and reduce churn.
Designed for operational efficiency, this system transforms a product list into a targeted client strategy.
skills_subtitle: Core strengths in data, ML, NLP & engineering
skills_adv_data_science_desc: Python (pandas, numpy, polars), SQL, statistical modeling, automated EDA.
skills_adv_ml_desc: Supervised & unsupervised, time series, advanced feature engineering, deep learning (RNN, LSTM), interpretability (SHAP, LIME).
skills_adv_nlp_desc: Hybrid RAG pipelines, LLMs (LangChain, Hugging Face), embeddings, prompt engineering, fine-tuning, RAG evaluation.
skills_adv_dataeng_desc: Modular pipelines, ETL, CI/CD, orchestration, Git, Python APIs (FastAPI, Streamlit).
skills_adv_cloud_desc: AWS, GCP: deployment, storage, pipeline orchestration.
skills_adv_viz_desc: Matplotlib, Plotly, interactive dashboards (Streamlit), clear documentation.
techskills_subtitle: Main technologies, libraries & tools I use daily
exp1_title: Square Management — Applied Research Intern (GenAI & RAG)
exp1_desc: I joined the R&D Lab to tackle a major challenge: **unlocking the value of unexploited strategic documents (Finance, CSR)**. These documents, often long and complex, were difficult to query. My mission was to build a **Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)** system capable not only of retrieving information but also ensuring **total traceability** for consultants.
exp1_task1: I conducted a rigorous comparative study of all technical components (from OCR to LLMs) to isolate the perfect combination for each document type.
exp1_task2: I designed a 'Document-Centric' architecture that respects the native structure of reports (tables, summaries) to preserve every semantic nuance.
exp1_task3: Finally, I delivered a reproducible experimental framework with over 150 tested configurations, scientifically measuring the impact of each choice on response quality.
exp1_task4: Stack: Python, LangChain, Hugging Face, FAISS, Azure OpenAI, Ragas.
exp2_title: City of Paris — Data Scientist (Mobility & Environment)
exp2_desc: I joined the Roads Department for a mission with high public impact: **enlightening sustainable mobility policies with data**. The goal was to precisely identify which company fleets contribute most to urban pollution to better target city actions.
exp2_task1: I built a massive data pipeline cross-referencing scattered sources (registrations, public registries, traffic data) while ensuring intensive cleaning to guarantee diagnostic reliability.
exp2_task2: I developed an Explainable Composite Pollution Score, factoring in every technical characteristic (engine type, age, critically) to segment economic actors.
exp2_task3: To finish, I transformed these analyses into decision-support tools (dashboards, reports) enabling policymakers to prioritize the most effective levers for action.
exp2_task4: Stack: Python, Pandas, Clustering, REST API, Data Visualization.
